note._content: this is an ex-theodolite (surveying instrument) tripod usually mahogany about 15 lbs (say 7 kgs) plus.  With brass screw fittings (yes I have used one) it is perilous slow to set up in ideal conditions, here, Il Maestro has control of it in minutes.  Admiration!

note._content: I think this is the switch for continuous shutter. 8 FPS right? :)
note.author: 60997319@N07

note._content:
Cable release

Sorry jokesters, this is no joke but a wire.  Not of the electrical type or support for the lens, but a spring steel wire in a flexible metal tube that he pushed to actuate the previously cocked manual shutter, which in those days was part of the lens.

FYI - Back then it was never a good idea to leave your spring shutter cocked when your camera was in storage, that is unless you wanted to shoot your 1/25 speed at 1/15 !
